lia.Monitor.JiniClient.ReflRouter
Class ReflNode

java.lang.Object
  lia.Monitor.JiniClient.ReflRouter.ReflNode
public class ReflNode
extends java.lang.Object

ReflNode is the rcNode for the reflectors. It holds Reflector-specific data

Constructor Detail

ReflNode

public ReflNode(java.lang.String UnitName,
                net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceID sid,
                java.lang.String ipad,
                ReflRouter router)
Constructor for the Reflector Node

Parameters:
UnitName - The name of the unit, as returned from farm
sid - unique identifier of the ML service
ipad - the IP address of the reflector
router - pointer to the ReflRouter class
Method Detail

addPeer

public void addPeer(ReflNode nn,
                    Result r)
For the current reflector adds a peer link, i.e. a link currently used by the reflector. If this link already exists, it refreshes the link's quality information.

Parameters:
nn - the peer node
r - the result that contains information about link's quality.

addInet

public void addInet(ReflNode nn,
                    Result r)
Same as addPeer but for the internet links monitored through ABPing. The MST is computed based on these results. The RTTime is minimized.

Parameters:
nn - the peer node
r - the result containing RTTime information about this link.

addReflInfo

public void addReflInfo(Result r)
Adds some info about the reflector, such as Nr. of Clients, Virtual Rooms etc. Currently, this is used just to flag that reflector as active

Parameters:
r -

isReflActive

public boolean isReflActive()
Check if reflector is still active

Returns:
reflector active or not

checkReflActive

public boolean checkReflActive()
Check if reflector is still active in differs from pervious method by not calling checkChangedStatus() to avoid deadlock

Returns:
reflector active or not
